snippet: Authorities said a 38-year-old man confessed to a grisly double murder in Kazan, in which two women were found brutally stabbed and with “Free! Pussy Riot” written in blood on a wall nearby.
abstract: Russian officials arrest Igor Danilevsky, who confessed to murdering two women in Kazan; Danilevsky tried to connect the killings to the controversy surrounding the punk band Pussy Riot, whose members were convicted of hooliganism for an anti-Putin protest.

byline.original: By ANNA KORDUNSKY and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

lead_paragraph: Authorities said a 38-year-old man confessed to a grisly double murder in Kazan, in which two women were found brutally stabbed and with “Free! Pussy Riot” written in blood on a wall nearby.

headline.seo: Russians Call Pussy Riot Murder-Site Note a Diversion
headline.main: Russians Call Pussy Riot Note at Murder Site a Diversion
headline.print_headline: Russians Call Murder-Site Note on Band a Diversion
